It contains all the natural enzymes, beneficial bacteria, and nutrients that support optimal digestion and immunity. Pasteurized milk, on the other hand, is subjected to high heat to kill off harmful bacteria, but this process also destroys the very beneficial components that make milk nutritious and safe in its natural state.

In terms of safety, many people assume pasteurization is the only way to ensure clean milk, but in reality, the quality of the milk comes down to the source and handling. When raw milk is produced on a clean, grass-fed farm with proper animal care and hygiene, it can be just as safe—if not safer—than pasteurized milk. In fact, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) has reported that the majority of outbreaks related to raw milk have been traced back to improper handling or unregulated sources, not the raw milk itself when handled correctly.

Health benefits are where raw milk truly shines. It contains naturally occurring probiotics, which support gut health and a strong immune system. These beneficial bacteria are destroyed during pasteurization. Raw milk also contains enzymes like lactase, which help break down lactose and can reduce digestive discomfort in many people who claim to be lactose intolerant.

Nutritionally, raw milk retains more of its vitamins, especially heat-sensitive ones like vitamin C and B vitamins, which are often diminished during pasteurization. It also maintains the full spectrum of minerals and fats in their natural form, which supports better absorption and utilization by the body.

So, when you look at the full picture—quality of source, nutritional integrity, and immune support—raw milk is not only a safer choice when responsibly produced, but also a more healthful one than pasteurized milk.
